Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lissu99
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a nice family holiday. We had two rooms with extra beds. Rooms were huge, bathroom was also very big. It was clean everywhere. And no noise during the nights. Breakfast was good. Staff was very helpful and polite. Free WLAN was available. Also it was possible to print e-tickets for the flight. Neighborhood was very nice and peaceful. Tube was close. And very good shopping street was also very near. We took a taxi back to the Tegel airport. It was only 20 euros (6 persons and our luggage)!

Reviews.Title: “Real single rooms”
Reviews.Author: Sten H Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Never found smaller rooms for single travellers. No recommendation for business trips. Bathroom is to small, useing the toilet was a problem... Breakfast was okay, also the drinks at the bar. Location is quite good, near the "Kaufhaus des Westens" and the tube A2 (good for drives to the "Messe Berlin").

Reviews.Title: “Faultless Stay”
Reviews.Author: GlobetrotterGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Stayed in triple room for 3 nights with family. Room was very spacious, warm and clean towels & toiletries supplied daily. Staff were very polite and friendly. Couldn't fault this hotel and would stay again if I return. Central to all including Ka Da We (big dept store) and 2 great restaurants around the corner Spanish & Turkish!! Great if you arrive late and too tired to get your bearings. Try both you wont be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “Can't have better hotel at this price”
Reviews.Author: mikkol
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 night stay in this hotel during Christmas, which it has a buy-2-get-1-free promotion. At 50 euros a night, I don't expect something spectacular but it was quite wonderful anyway. It's a block from the famous Kadewe shopping center with loads of cafes along its street. It's 1/2 block away from the closest metro station Augsburger Strasse. Note that such station does not have escalator / elevators (as many metro stations don't). From airport you may take a bus to zoologischer garten station, where you can take a metro change to there (which requires line change for that 2 stations distance and ups/downs of stairs during the change) or walk from there to hotel that needs about 10-15min. I guess they upgraded our room so it was quite big with a balcony (kinda useless in winter) where we can see the quiet street and its neighbourhood. The rooms + beds are basic (the professional photos would've fooled you) but clean and comfy. Hotel staffs are friendly and helpful responding inquiries in perfect English. There's also a gym + spa + sauna facility upstairs at 6th floor. One small complaint would be the free WIFI. Though free, it needs a unique user/password pair per day per device - kind of annoying, and the service gets cut off easily when I reached my room. Overall this hotel is still a great place for tourist to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, just a bit far from the centre”
Reviews.Author: Annalisa C
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this hotel because we had a smart box as a christmas gift. The hotel is really comfortable and clean, just 15 minutes from Tegel airport by taxi, and about 30 minutes with public transportation. If you travel for tourism, the position isn't the best, to get to the centre you have to take two different subway lines, and takes about 20 minutes, but you can easily take a tourist ticket, that also includes the entrances to a few museums, with wich you can also reach Potsdam. The hotel offers a nice breakfast, with a good choice of fresh fruit, yogurt and croissants. If you have to choose a place for dinner, the turkish resturant nex to the hotel is excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Two wonderful nights!”
Reviews.Author: Bimmersnob
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Extremely clean and well-furnished. We felt very safe while here, and the room was very quiet with a nice view of the courtyard and a view of the street between neighboring buildings. The rooms were a little small compared to what I'm used to in the U.S., but certainly adequate and the quality of our stay was enough to make all the difference! The beds and pillows were very comfortable, and the linens delightfully fresh! My only complaint was that the duvet thing provided was WAY too hot! The room is kept warm enough you could sleep with just a sheet though. There are no in-room temperature controls, but even as picky as I am I had no issue. It was incredibly cold outside and the entire hotel was perfectly warm without being suffocating. The bathroom, always a telling point of any hotel room, was very nice! Everything was impeccably clean, but remember to leave the door cracked when taking a hot shower as there is no vent fan. I was unfortunately very ill on our trip to Berlin, and the hotel staff at the desk showed great concern for me once it was mentioned by our guide. There were members of our group who had last-minute changes in their room preferences and the staff were very quick and friendly about accommodating them. There seemed to be a lot of rooms available, even though there were people seemingly everywhere. It was a busy, but polite and inviting place. The restaurant downstairs was very nice. We visited for dinner one night and had great food at the usual price for dinner anywhere out in Germany. The restaurant staff was perfect. The breakfast included in our tour looked like it was good, but unfortunately I am not a morning person and was unable to enjoy any since I always feel worse in the mornings when sick. As with most hotels, the snacks and fizzy beverages in the fridge will cost you if you partake. Bring your own snacks/drinks and save the money! I feel like I found a bit of home at the Alsterhof and I plan to return whenever I visit Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: my2cents2011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Berlin for Veterans day Weekend. We stayed for 2 nights. Our hotel price was 67 euros a night plus 16 euros a night for parking, which we weren't extremely happy about. We enjoyed the hotel. We opted for the smaller double vs the deluxe. Other reviewers complained about small rooms. The room was small, but definitely did the job. We had room for all our bags. Closet space and shelves. The bathroom was extremely small and clean and also did the job. There was free wi-fi once we obtained the password from reception. It appeared that it wasn't connected but worked okay. We never tried it from the lobby so I don't know if it would have been better there. The hotel was walking distance from some major shopping areas, but not to the Brandenberger Tor (Gate). I believe the Gate was about 3 miles away. There is a Netto (small grocery store) which is very close and train stations. The 100 bus runs close to the hotel also, as other reviewers mention. The reception staff spoke English very well, were very friendly and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jose189430
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pretty clean, the staff friendly, the bar at lobby veru cosy and the breakfast buffet is excellent. The hotel is also =well located near a subway station and the famous Kurfurstenstrasse. The only negative point is that there is no air conditioning and we were in the middle of summer and fan was not enough. But it did not diminiched the great imopression we have about this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but not 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: AlanPP
Reviews.Content: Smooth check-in with helpful frontdesk staff. Rooms are small, but nice. Location is excellent with only about 5 minutes walk to ka-de-we. Garage for the car just opposite of the hotel.(@ 15 €/day). All in all a good hotel - but to call it 4 star, is taking it a bit far.

Reviews.Title: “Fell short of expectations”
Reviews.Author: Lunapants
Reviews.Content: I was recently here for a work trip and was dissapointed by this "4 star" hotel. The room's corners were dirty, the bathroom constantly smelled like urine and the room needed a major update. The wifi was broken 3 of the 4 days I stayed and each day reception promised it would be fixed the next day. Not ideal for a business trip. There is not ventilation in the rooms so I often slept with the window open. Even on the sixth floor I was often woken up from street noise. During breakfast it is mentioned that eggs your way were included free but the restaurant is understaffed and I never managed to get anyones attention. The whole place is just tired feeling but in a nice location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Lons16
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located in a great area of West Berlin. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Nice and clean rooms and free internet on ground level. Would book again when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel not 4 star.”
Reviews.Author: Murphy1978
Reviews.Content: More 3 star than 4 star. No tea/coffee facilities in the room. Bed was not a double but somewhere between a single and double. Wireless internet was available in the room but sometimes weak signal. Had to insist on check out that I wanted and was entitled to my credit card bill in euro and not sterling. Clean rooms and overall a nice hotel but high opinions of itself.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but for the tiny bathroom”
Reviews.Author: DrErsatz
Reviews.Content: Very nice, 4 stars, but the bathroom! LOL, what were they thinking. Clean rooms, nicely done, decent size (except bathroom), WiFi, very helpful staff. Nice Restaurant, exercise floor & spa, did not use either. Near KaDaWe, downtown, nightlife, and mass transit. Noisy, so only go in cold weather with a closed window. Parking in underground lot takes some maneuvering. Skip breakfast and pick it up at the french dessert bar in KaDaWe (excellent!).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Front Desk”
Reviews.Author: Winnie49294201
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, helpful, polite and great English. The hotel itself is very good value and well located. We both loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Ich bin ein Berliner! (If not cold outside)”
Reviews.Author: Cirrus22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I we got a direct flight from Prague to Berlin in the middle of April 2011 during a trip we are doing in Europe. A friend recommended a hotel Alstrhuf west of the city. We stayed at this hotel 3 nights. Located on a quiet street 2 minutes walk kdw department store and a few minutes from Europe Center. We received a very large room but the furniture is outdated. The room was far to walk off the elevator but I did not want to change because it was a large room. But no hotel lobby. has a bar opposite the reception. reception is also small. There is also an internet corner at the entrance to a hotel. Breakfast is excellent and if there is a good day so you can eat in the dining room garden. I think the spa upstairs is very pleasant and I enjoyed a warm and wet sauna. You can enter a key of the room until midnight to the spa. If you are not looking for a luxury hotel then I would recommend it

Reviews.Title: “location great, hotel.....not so much”
Reviews.Author: samwabs
Reviews.Content: room sucked, bed and bedding were awful. Very outdated and kinda bad ikea. For some reason my wifi wouldnt work in the hotel, but did everywhere else. Also wifi only in lobby. The location is great, so if you can save money worth staying just for that reason only.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Kotikisu
Reviews.Content: Althought I'm quite pleased with my stay in this hotel, I expected a little bit more. I wouldn't rate this hotel as a four star, maybe three of three and a half. The room was clean and cozy, nice staff and location great! But my room was very hot (in April!!), no air conditioner and breakfast for 12 e was nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value hotel for Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Jamesreading
Reviews.Content: We spent a very comfortable 5 nights in the Alsterhof. It is in a quiet, pleasant and convenient location close to two U Bahn stations and about 10 minutes walk from a main station at Zoogarten. The famous KaDeWe departmental store is less than 5minutes walk away. The hotel staff are efficient, friendly and helpful.The croissant breakfast inc udes, fruit salad, fruit juices,cereals,youghurts, cheese, cold meats, rolls and jams. We booked direct and got a special deal for booking 3+ nights. Although not the basis of our trip this hotel is clearly well suited for business and conference users Travelling around Berlin is very easy and we would recommend the Berlin Welcome card for inclusive travel on trains,S Bahn, UBahn and Buses. If you wish to visit the Reichstag you MUST apply in advance on the relevant website before going to Berlin. We were disappointed as we were unaware of this recent requirement.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Duvlin63
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying in this Hotel. Found the rooms very clean good bathroom/shower, great value and right in the middle of the city near all the attractions. I found the reception desk staff very friendly & helpful. If you you do not have breakfast included in your rate there are plenty of cafes nearby. Will go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Steamy & sweaty”
Reviews.Author: SoutheastAsiaSusan
Reviews.Content: Originally, we did not book at the Alsterhof but due to the incompetence and inconsideration of the management of the Golden Tulip Hamburg (please read our separate review), we were forced to stay at this hotel. If it weren’t for this unfortunate circumstance, we admit that we probably would not have booked at the Alsterhof due its lower ranking and room pictures in the Tripadvisor, which were not appealing. The rooms at the Alsterhof did NOT have air conditioning. While we were in Berlin on 8-10 June 2010, the outside temperature ranged 28-30 degree Celsius so it was hot out. And in the rooms, we felt steamy and sweated through the nights in spite of having opened the windows. Although some of the rooms did have portable electric fans, they did little in cooling off the sauna-like rooms. If you like sleeping naked but still drenched in sweat during the summer, then this hotel is for you. On a more positive note, this hotel is centrally located, very near to Kadewe, one of Berlin’s largest up-market department stores. Additionally, we felt that the breakfast was decent. If you do decide to stay in this hotel, make sure that you ask for a newly renovated room at the front part of the hotel (the back wing is old and dilapidated). Finally, there is a computer at the lobby with free internet, but it was always occupied. There is no WiFi in the rooms or other public areas. In summary, you could probably find a better stay in Berlin somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not a 4 star hotel....”
Reviews.Author: phunkymatt
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel were great and let me indulge myself in speaking broken German. The hotel was in a good location, near to the residential district of Schoneberg. For us, it was the perfect place to be as we were there for the Folsom Europe weekend. It's close to the U Bahn and within walking distance of a number of places. However, this hotel caters mainly to corporate clients and I think this is the reason it charges high room rates. The room we stayed in was clean and comfortable but looked very dated. It was definitely not 4 star. Maybe it was 20 ago but they need to refurbish. Breakfast was very good and the service provided by the staff was good. However, the cost of breakfast meant that we went out some mornings instead. The hotel's wi-fi is patchy at best (not the ISP but the location of the wireless routers) and over priced. To connect, we had sit with our laptops next to the door of our room. This is only a minor point because who goes on holiday just to surf the internet? Overall, it was in a great location for our purposes and the staff were friendly. The rooms were comfortable and clean but don't be fooled by the 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: MazaFin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only a few blocks from KaDeWe departments store and the main shopping streets. Still the surroundings are quiet and safe. There is a u-bahn station very near but we walked every time to the U2 bahn station at Wittenbergplatz which is very close. The hotel is clean and a proper one to spend a few days. The staff is friendly and breakfast is very good. We had a large room at the 6th floor. The bed was huge. There was an air-conditioner in the room but we didn't use it. We opened the window for fresh air. We paid about 230 euros for three nights. There are several more luxurious hotels very near but there is no use to pay more as the hotel room is only for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: rvcj
Reviews.Content: $120.00 night for large commodious room with two full size and a fullsize cot. Great location next to Augsburer Strasse ubahn, just off KUFU near KADAWE and Xmas market at Kaiser Wilhelm

Reviews.Title: “A functional hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: MplusG
Reviews.Content: Went to Berlin to see the celebrations for the fall of the Berlin Wall (Nov. 9th) and stayed in this Hotel. Overall, it is a functional place, good for a base to stay in while visiting this magnificent city. The room was n the small side, but nice and clen. The public areas are very sparse and are devoid of atmosphere. Breakfast was like a zoo the three mornings we were there, I think because they had a number of coach tours, and all the guests descended like a swarm of locuats on the restaurant at the exact same time. But all that being said, we had no problems with the Alsterhof. One thing I've never seen before - they have a weird security system, whereby you can only use the elevator to the bedrooms by waving the tag of your bedroom key in front of a sensor in the elevator itself. This was a bit inconvenient, because they only have one key per room

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, good rooms, breakfast, location”
Reviews.Author: PVSCalifornia
Reviews.Content: The staff could not have been more helpful. Great location, just off the KuDam, around the corner from KaDeWe. Easy access to Ubahn, only one block. The room was just fine, very clean and comfortable. The breakfast was all one could want. A bargain at @$135 US per night. Just a word of caution. No air conditioning, so do not stay there in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: impressa
Reviews.Content: Even though the hotel is strategically located near an underground station, to get to the hotel is a hassle with public transportation. You will need to change trains twice from Central Station (Hauptbahnhof). When I arrived (2.04 pm), there was only 1 person on duty. He was on the phone and the rest of the guests were waiting. Once he was finished with the phone conversation, he looked at me and said "Hi, I'll be back..." That's the first time I have heard "Hi" being said to a guest in a 4 Star Hotel. I was given the key to my room and told the room is one the second level. Interesting. I was not even asked whether I prefer smoking or non-smoking room. I had to ask where the lifts were. Best of all no effort is made to advise Guests on the breakfast hours and where breakfast will be served. The room is small, relatively modernly furnished with LCD screen. However the door does not perfectly fit hence I could see the light from the coridor. What a great way to get sleep! I can't beleive there is no handsoap and there was no dish either for the soap. When I checked out, I was asked did I use the mini-bar? I said to the same gentleman the mini-bar was locked. He said "oh the key is with the room key" Great! Will I ever stay here again? Perhaps when all other hotels are fully booked.

Reviews.Title: “Below average for a 4 star city hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Brian-Angela
Reviews.Content: Basic city hotel with little to make it stand out from the crowd. Fine if you want to be in the middle of the "western shopping" part of the city but quite a long way from the far more interesting sites/sights which visitors would wish to see. Bedrooms were really very "tired" and worn and need quite a make-over to bring them to full modern standard. Badly stained, worn carpet with accumulated carpet-dust in corners and around the edges. Cracked/crazed sink in bathroom. (Accumulated dust on glasses in bedroom made us a little worried about other issues of cleanliness.) Garage parking limited to about a dozen spaces only so don't expect convenience of this facility. Very friendly, helpful reception staff. Good breakfast content although breakfast room does get crowded (guests did wait for tables). Pricey evening restaurant with fairly average menu choice. (Good Turkish restaurant two short blocks away.) Hard to recommend as there are much better hotels in this price range in the city. Not really up to 4 star standard at all.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty nice. Good location, rooms are clean.”
Reviews.Author: SunnyIsrael
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located for those who are looking for the more wealthy districts of Berlin. just one minute from KDW and Ku'dam. Rooms was big enough and clean. The only probelm in the room was that it was a very hot summer and there was only a small fan, no a/c. But I can't blame them for that because it was an unexpectedly hot summer comparing to Germany. It was still OK for me but my friend realy suffered. The reception was OK, no special problems and they kept our luggage after check-out because our flight was late. A blonde guy one the reception was nice and smiling but other staff were pretty cold. But anyway, they did their job. General impression - we got a very good value for money because there was a special deal, hotel facilities are in a very good condition, but it is not a place I am eager to go back to, though if it turns out to be that i have to sleep there again - I will be totally fine with it.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: They say that it is a four-star hotel but it feels more like a 3-star hotel. Good location and staff but it feels like a boring charterplace. Why do they still have ordinary keys? When you leave the hotel you have to leave them in reception and you have to get them from reception when you come back. Too much trouble!! Small rooms and you can't open the windows completely and there is no AC. I stayed for six nights and the last morning they ran into the room and checked the minibar. Don't they trust the customers if they say thay haven't used the minibar? Worthless!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,great location, helpful friendly staff,good food.”
Reviews.Author: robbly
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for one night recently and found the hotel was in a great location. Very near to Kurdam and Zoo, so all transport was within a ten minute stroll. We have been to Berlin several times and have found this hotel to be in the best location so far. Room was a good size and clean, staff all spoke good english and were very helpful. We left our cases at the hotel all day while we did some exploring, no problem. Breakfast was varied and a reasonable price, dinding room was spacious, clean and light. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base & excellent value”
Reviews.Author: coffeebucks
Reviews.Content: I am really baffled as to why this hotel has poor reviews - I stayed for three nights and it was wonderful. The staff coped really well with my dreadful German - they all speak excellent English if you don't want to give it a go - and were very polite and pleasant. The room was spacious as it was a corner room, but the other room I saw was similarly large and the beds were very comfy. The bathroom was similarly spacious and clean with a full bath and shower. As I stayed in July it was very warm and I had the window open every night, all night. I was on the 5th floor and imagine if it was not possible to do this (e.g in a 1st floor room) it would be too oppressive to sleep. When the chambermaids had closed the window in the middle of the day it was ridiculously hot when we got back to the room. It's in a really quiet area and about 10 mins walk from Bahnhof Zoo, so it's about half an hour from Alexanderplatz and surrounding places in Mitte. If this doesn't bother you (and it shouldn't - Berlin is the best city in Europe to get around by rail) then I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bad smell in the room”
Reviews.Author: ThomasSthlm
Reviews.Content: Very small room to be a 4 star hotel. Friendly staff but not to entuastic. When we first arrive did we get a room with a VERY bad smell from the toilett. No problem to change. But the second room still have some bad smell. No playgrounds in this area - if you come with small kids. Only just Zoo, which is really great but nothing you could do every day. Usually did we take the tube to other areas of Berlin. Next time will we take a hotell in Prenzlauer Berg instead. This hotell was very cheap and we also get a cheap deal. Not much. Next time maybe pay a little bit more some where else.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most exciting.”
Reviews.Author: juhinho
Reviews.Content: A bit bland hotel in the west side of the city. Location is not bad, at least if you have time to walk. There's no decent restaurants, shops, or much anything nearby. Staff was ok, maybe not the most enthusiastic I have met. Rooms looked just like every other 3-star hotel in Europe. But the breakfast was a nice surprise, good selection of everything, and terrific rolls & bread.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location, service”
Reviews.Author: EuropeValueSeeker
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my second stay at the Alsterhof. The first was two years ago. I had an excellent experience both times. The only change I noticed on the second visit was the installation of new flat screen TVs. I typically travel solo and in decending order I value location, quality exercise equipment, service/ammenities, and breakfast. (Not to mention that I look for a good deal when I can find one!) Sure, I could have paid 3x more at the Marriott to get the fancy soap, but for what else?

Reviews.Title: “Not very clean”
Reviews.Author: ciog52
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a five night stay in the hotel. Arrived early and left my luggage at reception. They do have a room for storing luggage and this is where my case was kept.The room itself was ok but the area around the bath had mold growing on it. I pointed this out to both the reception and the cleaning staff. Nothing happened. On the third day I tackled them again about the problem . Explanation given was the cleaning staff are Chinese and do not speak either English or German so they could not guarantee the problem could be resolved.I insisted on changing rooms and was eventually given a room on the executive floor.That room was much larger but with worn and dirty carpet.The breakfast buffet is adequate .The internet access is like a small telephone box with no seat.Location is quiet but the U bahn station is not on a main line and you have to change trains twice to get to Zoo Station which has connections to most places and the 100 & 200 buses stop there. It is 20 minutes walk to the hotel from there or 5 minutes by cab. Cost 5euro. Hasir restaurant on the corner of the street is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever. Smells bad.”
Reviews.Author: pelicanoPortugal
Reviews.Content: A very bad hotel. To avoid. First, the location. It's not that good for the center attractions and not well connected to public transports. Second, the staff. Very arrogant, not helpful at all. Finally the room. Kind of small, bad furnished and without any air-conditioning. I have stayed 7 nights and they just changed the sheets once and I think they never changed the towels. I have to refer to the most disgusting thing in this hotel. The bathroom have a open sewer of a kind, next to the bathtub that exhales the most noxious odor. And this was true in my bedroom and also in the other bedrooms of the hotel where fellow Portuguese travelers stayed. I most warn everybody to avoid this hotel. They haven’t no English instructions for the phone, they don’t have a proper luggage deposit, our luggage just stayed in the lobby and anyone can open it or take it. (We tried the last part and they didn’t care)

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: IdoTLV
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights. Here are my impressions: Pros: - extremely clean rooms - quite spacious rooms - rooms include all necessary features (safe, TV, hair-drier etc.) - located within walking distance to main shopping area (5 min. to KaDeWe, 10 min. to Ku-damm) - located very near to U-Bahn (Metro) station (called after the street's name "Augsburger", 1 min. walking from hotel), so it's easy to get to any point in the city through the public transportation (hotel reception also sell one-way tickets and day tickets to the public transportation at the same price as at the machines in the stations) - helpful english-speaking staff - very good choice at breakfast (cereals, eggs, bacon, cheese, ham, jams, croissant, juices, coffee and tea and more). - located on a quiet street which means no car/train noise at night. Cons: - quite distant from main attractions in the east side of the city, though it's easy to get there with the public transportation. - U-bahn line that runs near the hotel is relatively uncentral (but you can change trains as much as you want so it's not a big issue). - No air condition (only heating that works whenever the hotel wants) - equipment in the room (telephone, heating) has German instructions on it, no english. Overall: Would highly recommend it to anyone. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at Alsterhof Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NadiaMoscu
Reviews.Content: For everyone travelling to Berlin on different purposes I would stongly recommend this hotel. It has a very good location? it is located in the very center, the entrance to U-Bahr (Ausburger) is close to the hotel door (2 min walk), and besides the district is calm, clean and quite fashionable. You will find two good restaurants just at the coner of the street- a Turkish one and a Spanish one. Alsterhof is a 4 star hotel.It is well furnished and even has a gym but I did not have opportunity to visit it. I stayed in the hotel fro the 29 of Feb to the 4 of March, I even met a few of my country fellows staying in this hotel too, which was a pleasant surprise for me. I had brakfast included. The brekfast was very good and quite exquisitly served. I liked especially the selection of tea. In the lobby you can find free Internet and a smart cafe. The thing that I did not like is that in the bathroom there were no shampoo and other things of this kind, only liquid soap. But everything was clean and neat. There was also a free safe deposit box in the room. The room was quite small for two but the beds are huge and comfortable. All this makes staying in this hotel pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: Ballard98107
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Berlin via train from Kracow on the East side of "town." I continued onward and got off at the Zoologischer Garten station and walked to the Alsterhof. It was a decent shuffle through Europa Center and I did know that there was a connecting U bahn- U9 I believe- but it is a worthwhile trip to get a glimpse of things. The staff at the Alsterhof allowed me an early check in since the room had been cleaned and were more than accomodating. I think I would have to agree with the positive statements thus far and I would be hard pressed to find a fault with my stay there. As far as location there is great shopping nearby and tons of things going on at the Zoo. I made great use of the internet cafe at the Dunkin Donuts near the station, which conveniently was also the place where I met up with an Insider Tour group.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel good location”
Reviews.Author: nóinín
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the alsterhof in October 2007. It is situated on a quiet street just five minutes from a busier area with shops, restaurants, sightseeing bus stop. There is a U-bahn station just a few metres from the hotel, but it is a fairly minor line. However, the station at Wittenburg platz has more lines and is only a 5 minute walk and the S-bahn at the Zoo is about 10-15 minute walk. The staff were extremely helpful. The rooms were small, but clean and pleasantly decorated. Overall we were very satisfied with the hotel and its services, but we were under the impression that breakfast was included in the price of the rooms. We only found out at checkout that it was an extra E12 per person. Luckily enough the breakfast was nice!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Superb Hotel”
Reviews.Author: keaty6
Reviews.Content: Keaty 6 Ireland (Three couples) Stayed here on a four day sight seeing trip and found that this hotel was exactly what we were looking for. Its situation is great for walking to most of the sights. Rooms are good as was breakfast. Cocktails in the bar were not bad either. No Complaints and would reccommend this hotel highly and its very reasonably priced

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, polite staff, nice position”
Reviews.Author: Brownbuddies
Reviews.Content: On arrival in Berlin we were amazed at how easy it was to get a bus to the Berlin Zoo which is walking distance from this hotel. The ticket machines are easy to use too, touch the screen and then choose English. The airport is in Zone B, but literally everywhere else we went in Berlin (including our hotel) was in Zone A so the tickets were easy to buy as it was the same one every time. We bought single tickets on each journey but I would suggest you buy a travel card (tagaskarte) which are on sale at the ticket office. There are no ticket barriers at any of the stations and I didnt see a single inspector in the 4 days I spent there but if you do get caught you will be charged 40 euros so better to be safe than be sorry. The hotel staff are polite and the room is clean and the bed was so comfy I didnt want to get up! I would suggest you learn some basic German before you arrive because the German people will be so much nicer to you if you at least TRY to speak German. We visited Checkpoint Charlie (very small so try to get there early before it gets busy), Topographie des Terrors (is outside and is all in German unless you buy the audio guide, but is also right next to the largest standing part of the Berlin Wall), The Story of Berlin (only really worth a visit for the tour down to the nuclear shelter), The Siegessaule (a walk through the park on the way is relaxing), The Reichstag (the queue was too long and didnt appear to be moving so we didnt go inside), Zoologischer Garten (fabulous day out, especially if you have children), The film museum (for fans of German film only), Fernsehturm (enjoy a drink in the bar at the top if you dont suffer from vertigo!), and of course The Brandenburg Gate (a passing glance was enough, but a sit outside the coffee shop to watch the crowds go by is even better). We were sight seeing from 10am till closing time every day and we still didnt see everything we wanted to. In the evenings we ate in local German restaurants that were recommended in the Time Out guide but the best meal we had was in Henne in Leuschnerdamm 25. The only thing on the menu is half a milk roasted chicken and you can choose between potato or cabbage salad (although we had both and shared) but it was the most delicious chicken I have ever tasted. Crispy on the outside, moist and succulent on the inside. The waitresses were lovely, and especially friendly when we tried to talk German to them and it was jam packed full of Germans. I would definately recommend this hotel as it is clean, comfortable and the staff are friendly. It is opposite a tube station and the tube service is just as easy to use as the London service but its cleaner and more regular.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: BEENROUNDTHEWORLD
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my partner. I thought it was very good value for money and also very central. Checking-in staff very pleasant and helpful. Breakfast was excellent and unlike some hotels, they kept replenishing the food right up to the last minute. I would return to this hotel and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Very good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: RRichie
Reviews.Content: Hi I stayed at this hotel because of its central position, I found the hotel to be ideal for me. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the maid service is excellent. The hotel bar is very small but there are plenty of bars nearby, the food was very good but pricey but again found plenty of places to eat nearby. Overall this is a very good reasonably priced hotel in a good position to explore Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “We were only there for the bier!”
Reviews.Author: No_memory_of_Trees
Reviews.Content: Visited Berlin and stayed at the Alsterhof last weekend with a party of twelve celebrating the impending marriage of one of our number. Overall a good location for transport around the city, and a great one if you like shopping (not something we did a great deal of unless beer counts). Rooms and public areas are clean and smart enough. My single room on the fifth floor wasn't big and was very warm (I had the window open constantly for three days) Didn't eat in the Hotel, but can recommend the Cafe am neuen See in Tiergarten if you fancy a half hour stroll before breakfast. Hindsight also suggests that from this end of the city, get German Transfer or a taxi to Schonefeld rather than the S-bahn. The train took ages and goes through some of the less glamorous part of the city on the way to the airport station, where you have to walk the last half mile to the teminal! Overall, thank you Alsterhof Hotel, German Transfer and the people of Berlin for an enjoyable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Denver_Mullican
Reviews.Content: Great location a few blocks away from the KaDeWe department store and a ten minute walk to the zoo. Service is very good, rooms are spacious and the front desk staff is extremely helpful. There is free Internet access in the lobby. There are a number of good restaurants in the area and the Turkish restaurant next door is quite good and prices are very reasonable. Denver Mullican New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: morgangeth
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights in the Alsterhof ,very good hotel,great location off the main strasse Kurferstenndam ,which is only a 10 mts walk,the Torre Negro resturant 2 minutes walk very good for steak and chips plus number of other dishes,also chinese place called Asia Land we a very good meal there.We did find the hotel prices,food, drink expensive but all the hotels are like that,but that will not stop us going back this lovely peasefull hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: shanesmanor
Reviews.Content: got a great deal on this hotel for a 3 night stay 13-15 feb through expedia and my wife and i were very happy with our stay in this hotel. a ten minute walk takes you to the zoo gardens where you can catch transport to anywhere you want, staff in the hotel were all excellent and a minor fault with the room safe was quickly rectified. we did not eat in the hotel as it was a bit pricey but their were loads of options close by. we ate twice in a little spanish run restaurant torre negro which is located 100 metres from the hotel 1st left after you turn left out of the hotel. food was excellent and more than reasonably priced and the staff were friendly and attentive. rooms were what we would expect from a hotel of this rating. if you want to see the sites of berlin then i would recommend the free walking tour run by [--], the tour guide was fantastic and you just tip what you think is reasonable, its better than the bus tours and more imformative. after doing this tour use the 100 and 200 bus service which you can catch at the zoo gardens to go and see the places which interest you most.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: djfozzer
Reviews.Content: Located in a great quietish location within a few minutes walk from KaDeWe, Zoogarden and very close to U-Bahn (Augsberger Strs). The room was a nice size, only complaint would be that beds were very soft and room was warm (no aircon). Additional facilities looked good with a cosy bar and well equipped fitness centre. Many restaurants and bars are within walking distance. I'd thoroughly recommend Hasir which is 100 metres away - excellent and plentiful Turkish food. Given the price we paid a good value hotel suitable for business travellers, family and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: MTalbot
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay. Alsterhof is in a great location within a tidy and quiet neighbourhood. Just a few minutes walk from KaDeWe, Europa centre and Zoogarden. Room was great, clean and spacious. Staff were polite, very helpful and knowledgeable of the surrounding area. Breakfast was plentiful, buffet style with lots to choose from. Delicious! Also, there is a nice little bakery across the street and quiet coffee house just around the corner. Many restaurants and bars are within walking (or staggering) distance and the U-Bahn station "Augsburger Strasse" is right outside the hotel. Fantastic location for venturing into the city or to the airports if needs be. All in all a great stay, thanks Alsterhof.

Reviews.Title: “A Hard Review To Write”
Reviews.Author: Raym_London
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights and have mixed feelings about this hotel. I booked a single room - big mistake. It was no bigger than a matchbox and didn't even have a wardrobe, just a small rail that pulled out from the end of the bed, which was set against a wall. The bed was quite high and the draws for clothes were below the mattress. So no closet, no chest of draws and a room the size of a phonebox. I complained but was told nothing doing, hotel was full and I got what I'd paid for, a single room. Breakfast was adequate, but the worst I've had in all my trips to Berlin. It had all the usual, egg, bacon, cheeses etc but no smoked salmon and was not great for a 4 star hotel. It done its job but didn't make you want to refill your plate a second time. It wasn't all bad though. The actual hotel is very nice and has a quite expensive feel about it and as mentioned by others the location is superb. I always try to stay near the Kudamm, and this is on a quite street just behind the KaDeWe. I couldn't have wished for a better spot. A supermarket and some very nice restaurants a 2 min walk away with Zoo station a 10 min stroll. The staff were very friendly and helpful apart form one (there's always one!) but this was the guy I complained to so we probably got off on the wrong footing. The rest were fine and pleasant. Would I stay again? If the price was right and only in a double room. I would trade the breakfast off for the location which again is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: carolp1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Alsterhof and it has to be one of the best hotels I have stayed in. We booked it through a last minute deal and didn't really know what to expect but as we were only there for 3 nights and got it cheap we didn't care. The rooms were spotless, a good size and cleaned daily. The staff were helpful and polite and the location couldn't have been better. Just off Kurfurstendam it was really close to shops, restaurants, buses and the train station. We will definitely be back. Can't wait!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel In the Best Placement”
Reviews.Author: JAVIER DE LA CRUZ CONEJO
Reviews.Content: The hotel is place, in my opinion, in the best neighborhood of Berlin. The rooms are confortable and all is very clean. You can visit all the city very quickly, because the zoogarden station is very near. The hotel is clean and quiet, you can recover easy with the big breakfast you can take

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Our room was very nice. Double bed plus a futon couch. The room was located in the rounded portion section of the hotel. My mother on the other hand had a room that was the size of a walk in closet. You weren't able to walk around the bed, there wasn't enough room. The breakfast is wonderful, everything you can imagine. It is located only 2 blocks from KaDeWe, a taxi line, the subway, and the sightseeing bus. There is also a terrific turkish restaurant 2 blocks away,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - fantastic location!!”
Reviews.Author: Kytttenkat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alsterhof for 3 nights in late November this year after booking a cheap deal on lastminute. The location is superb, situated in the centre down a quieter road just off of all the main shopping streets. Its a 5/10 minute walk from the Zoo and the central station. There is also a metro station just down the road from the hotel entrance. There are lots of restaurants and bars nearby which offer a great selection of food for every taste. The hotel room was a good size and very clean. The beds were very comfy and the bathroom had a good powerful shower. We were overlooking the beer garden, and found the location great as it was very quiet and we never had any noise from outside or from other guests. The breakfast was vast and had a wide choice to choose from - enough to keep you going all day! Staff were very helpful and spoke perfect English. They were always very friendly and cheerful towards us. I would recommend the Alsterhof to anyone wanting to stay in Berlin, it was excellent value for money and in a perfect location to explore the city. I would definantly return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, English Speaking, Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Mooeyitfc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Hotel Alsterhof between the 4th and 6th December, and spent the weekend in Berlin. It was fantastic. The Hotel was very good. Great great location, within walking distance of great shopping, xmas markets, the zoo, the main train station etc... and there is a U bahn station just outside the doorstep. When we checked in, there were candles all round the reception, they advised us that the hotel had no power between 1-6pm. We were out most of the afternoon anyway so it wasnt too much bother. When we returned however we were promised candles in our room by one receptionist and then it was not fulfilled. They didnt really know what to offer as light. They said we werent allowed candles. Im guessing because of fire or smoke risk however we were in a smoking room!? Anyway they eventually found us a flashlight that we had to use for an hour. The reception staff are fairly helpful, however do speak very good english. Our room was a lovely size, it was a double room, however two twin beds pushed together, however it didnt bother me. The bathroom was a nice size as well, with lovely bath and powerful shower. Everywhere was so clean and tidy. Just one tip for English people, the hotel does not have tea and coffee making facilities in the room and they also dont have english tea. closest you'll get is scented tea. As for breakfast, it was delightful. Lots of choice, we went down late both days so it was very busy so I would advise to go down earlier. On offer was Tea, coffee, fruit juices, Cereals, Bread and Rolls, Croissants, Pastries, Fruit Salad, Yoghurts, Dried Fruit, and Hot food including bacon, scrambled eggs, minced meat balls, boiled eggs, baked beans, and potatos. And to finish pancakes with maple syrup yum yum! You cant go far wrong with a breakfast like that to start the day. As for the evening the restaurant we found wasnt very popular with guests. It was very expensive in relation to some of the other eating places around but I guess it is a four star hotel. there was only 4 other people in the restaurant when we went in, so no atmosphere. If you want a great meal for next to nothing money, just turn out of the hotel and turn right. At the traffic lights turn right again and on the right hand side there is a restaurant called Toro Negro. Very busy, all candle lit, great atmosphere, great music. Its a spanish run place but they do all sorts of food. Pizza, pasta, mexican, tapas, Salads etc... We had Camebert, Large Rump Steak with Chips, Mozzerella and Herb pizza, 2 fantas, Crepes with icecream, 2 beers, and 1 wine and it came to 34 Euros! How cheap is that? The waitresses speak fairly good english as well. So overall the hotel was very good for what we paid for it, other than the electricity problem, we had a great time, and I would throughly recommend a stay in Berlin and a stay in this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in Berlin at the Alsterhof Hotel. The service was surperb. Always willing to help and gave excellent advise. On arrival asked if wanted smoking or non smoking room and were given the floor of non smokers. The rooms are very clean and the double bedroom is of average size and quite comfortable. The bathroom is quaint but suitable for our needs with a bath and all the necessary requirements. Their breakfasts are one of the better we have ever had in a 4 star hotel in Europe and kept us going the whole day till the evening. The location of the hotel is definitely a fanastic advantage.Perfectly located with a 5 minute walk from the centre of Berlin in both directions and has excellent resturants in the close by vicinity. The lobby and internet service were of the highest qualities and is definitely a 4 star hotel. I would definitely return to stay when I visit Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Reception Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back in UK from 4 nights at the Alsterhof. We chose this hotel over the internet. It proved to be a great choice - very central and we spent 2 days walking in the local area, soaking up the history. Rooms not overlarge but perfectly adequate. Wonderful German duvets, so cosy. Very easy to use nearby underground when we wanted. Hotel reception staff were excellent. All quite young - quiet but unobtrusive and very efficient. A problem with our safe was dealt with quickly and effectively. On our last morning the reception staff arranged for us to have breakfast before 6.00 as we needed to be away early for our flight. The taxi we ordered arrived reassuringly early. First time we have booked direct with Internet and no problems at all. Also made good use of the free internet access. Thanks Alsterhof staff, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic 2.5 star hotel by american standards”
Reviews.Author: dwperkins
Reviews.Content: Best point for the hotel is location which is fantastic. 2 blocks from gay schoenberg area, a block from KaDeWe department store. But it is definitely NOT a four star hotel as they rate themselves. No air conditioning, no amenities in bathroom except the towells and a soap pump. Just a decent clean room with not so great bedding. Very average. But I got it on priceline for $65.00 US so for that price it is a value. But I wouldn't pay more than that because this hotel is nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay at the Alsterhof”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Location is fine, place is clean, and no problems with the bathroom, but oh that postage-stamp bed for two ... and when we asked the next day to be moved to a room with either twins or a decent-sized bed, we were told that the hotel was full up. I'm ambivalent about staying here again. I got a much better deal at the Marriott Potsdamer Platz on a previous trip. Sure, the Alsterhof is in a great location, but I liked the nice big king-sized bed at the Marriott, and both are convenient to Berlin's extensive public transport. If I ever book the Alsterhof again, I'll be sure to ask for a decent bed!

Reviews.Title: “First timers to Germany strike it lucky!”
Reviews.Author: mos13_2000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was definitely worth every penny we paid. The staff were plentiful and polite, the rooms clean and professional and the location was perfect. As a general guide the hotel is situated 1 block away from one of the main shopping centers of Berlin. Everything from the zoo to bars were within meters of the Alsterof, not that this mattered as the underground in Berlin is so extensive that every street corner seemed to has access. The breakfast was your usual choice of fruits, juices and grills and the bar is relaxing but a little pricey. Internet access in the foyer was free and 24 hours. Despite going in the middle of many snow storms the rooms were so cosy it was quiet a shock stepping back outside! Can highly recommend trying the small and local bars that appear randomly in the surrounding area. Most we tried came from a leaflet available in the foyer called "Insomnia", which if followed leads you to some character rich venues, all of which seem to have love for strange cocktails and low lighting. Very European! Would definitely return to the Alsterhof when next in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel !”
Reviews.Author: Kruk1959
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great city. We booked a double room through Top International Hotels' web page at rate EUR 77/night excluding breakfast for 3 nights Friday to Monday in June. Our room was a large corner room (#422). Very clean, good size, perfect beds, quiet. Even an electric table-fan, to keep the room cool. Staff was friendly and professional, smiling. We very much recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Few Tips!”
Reviews.Author: Antsuz78
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent two nights here in mid June 2005. My first big tip for you is if you are a non-smoker, when checking in make sure you request a non-smoking room, even if you have done so in your booking. We were given a smoking room and the smell was pretty bad. Apart from that, the bed was very small, barely a double size, and the bathroom was miniscule. Second tip - they don't provide any toiletries (shampoo/soap/conditioner) so a good idea to take your own. But the room was clean, there was no noise from any other room or outside and there was a fan in the room although it wasn't hot enough to use it! With the windows open there was a fair amount of street noise although it was quite cool so we kept them shut. Breakfast was fantastic, hot and cold buffet with everything you could want. The pancakes are great, like real American pancakes, not French crepes!! Berlin is an amazing city, and now tops my list of favourites! We recommend catching a train out to Savignyplatz and eating at the Zillemarkt restaurant there - the meals are massive, and scurmptious, and cheap!! A true German experience with sausages, schnitzels and lots of meat and veg dishes.

Reviews.Title: “TOP but HOT Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sers76
Reviews.Content: An average hotel that should be classed as a good 3*, We would recomend the hotel for the cold winter months but without air conditioning the rooms were like saunas during our stay. Good Points: Very close to Ausberger Strasse U Bahn, although this is a minor line so you do have to make lots of changes, but these are quick and simple! Free internet point in reception (if you can grab a free computer) Very clean standard room, but no freebies in the bathroom! Cocktail bar small but nice, staff friendly in here but not as helpful on reception. Good retaurants around the corner, central location in which to explore this fab city!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and good clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: MerseyBoy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Alsterhof for three nights in December 2004 - couldn't have been a better location - about ten minute walk to Zoo station and only a couple of minutes from the Ku'damm. What we really appreciated was that it was in a very quiet street and desite it being a busy city there was very little noise at night. Breakfasts were excellent with a wide choice of hot and cold food. Only one very minor complaint - the bathroom was quite small - but, hey, who goes to Berlin to spend time in the bathroom! Definitely recommended, especially if you can get a good deal as prices seem to vary quite considerably, presumably depending on demand and the time of year.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: LifeExperience
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Alsterhof in March. The hotel is well equipped, clean and friendly. The front desk staff were always helpful and knowledgeable and spoke good English. The breakfast selection was vast and would please all tastes. Located a stones throw from a metro station and one block behind the famous Ku'Damm in a quiet street away from the hustle and bustle. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Check out last minute web site for some fantastic out of season hotel rates.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Alsterhof Berlin
HotelInfo.Address: Augsburger Strasse 5, 10789 Berlin, Germany
